mods.abstract: Court and entrance to Temple of Seti I at Abydos (New Kingdom Dynasty XIX); ruined facade of the court and entrance of the mortuary Temple of Seti I; two Egyptian men before five broken pillars depicting Seti I with Horus and other gods wearing several different types of crowns, incised cartouches of Rameses II support theory that he continued building Temple after father's death; "A. Beato 48" in white and brown across bottom of print; "Facade of Temple at Abydos." in brown ink under print left side of mat.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
